definition: in a great mess/chaotic
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
dumpling
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: Jack shot from out of a ruck of players.
sentences.chinese: 杰克从乱成一团的运动员中把球踢出。

sentences.english: There was utter pandemonium outside the university building as ambulances carted away the injured.
sentences.chinese: 随着救护车带走受伤的人，大学主楼外绝对乱成一团。

sentences.english: His room is a mess. He cannot find his soccer jersey.
sentences.chinese: 房间乱成一团，他的球衣也不知道扔哪去了。

sentences.english: A： This place has been a mess since your cat， Sweet， moved in.
sentences.chinese: 自从你的猫甜甜搬进来之后，这地方就乱成一团。

sentences.english: The spools of thread in this box have become tangled.
sentences.chinese: 这个盒子的线轴都乱成一团了。

sentences.english: The thread has got all snarled up; I can't untie it.
sentences.chinese: 线都乱成一团了，我解不开了。

sentences.english: If pages are cluttered people can't find information.
sentences.chinese: 如果页面乱成一团糟，那么人们就没法找着信息。

definition: noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
chaotic/topsy turvy/a complete mess
(lit.) a pot of porridge/(fig.) a complete mess
rushed and muddled
clamorous/noisy/sensational/very exciting
to scatter in all directions
numerous and disorderly
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
(of a group of people) to run about helplessly
(idiom) everything broken and in disorder
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub
to flee in disarray/to scatter
to disperse in confusion (idiom)
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
